Legal_Issue: Extension of appeal time due to administrative errors
Evidence_Assessment: Trademark agents' errors caused delayed notification
Decision_Outcome: Extension of time for appeal granted
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show genuine intention and arguable case
Credibility_Factor: No fault found on applicant's part
Legal_Rule: Appeal must be filed within two months or further time as court may allow
Procedural_Issue: Delayed notification due to agent error
Grounds_for_Claim: Administrative errors leading to missed deadline
Outcome_on_Merits: Applicant had an arguable case on likelihood of confusion
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant acted diligently despite agent error
Key_Evidence_Considered: Agent error, intent to appeal, strength of underlying case
Applicant_Challenge: Meeting appeal deadline due to late notice
Court_Result: Extension granted; applicant to pay respondent's costs
Defendant_Response: Opposition to extension based on timeliness
Remedy_Requested: Extension of time to file appeal
Remedy_Sought: Permission to appeal out of time
Jurisdiction: Federal court (implied under Canadian trademark law)
